parameters: Greetings, warrior! Welcome to the \c[4]Battle Arena\c[0]!
What can I help you with?
\>What \c[4]Battle Engine Plugins\c[0] would you like to learn about?\<

<WordWrap>The default battle system for \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0] now allows for the ever so popular side-view! However, we can beef it up a little bit more using the Battle Engine Core to add more features and capabilities to the battle system!

<WordWrap>\c[4]Action Sequence Packs\c[0] provide more \c[4]Action Sequences\c[0] to be used with the \c[4]Battle Engine Core\c[0]. The first adds more mechanic-related sequences. The second adds more visual sequences. The third adds zoom functionality.
<WordWrap>This extension plugin allows you to animate enemies in a number of ways to help make your enemies appear more lively!

<WordWrap>The \c[4]ATB\c[0] system starts off with your characters filling up their gauges before they can input an action. Once an action is inputted, they start to quickly charge it up before going to perform their attack.

<WordWrap>Battle participants are placed in a visible turn order based on their agility and speed. When it becomes their turn, they input an action and execute it immediately, then proceed back in line.

<WordWrap>The default counterattack trait in RPG Maker MV doesn’t give many options for the developer. It’s a skill that flatout cancels out the physical skill of the attacker by evading it and then producing a normal attack from the counterattacker.
<WordWrap>This plugin will give you more control over how counters work in the sense that you can choose to have the counter connect first before allowing the counter skill to proc.
<WordWrap>Want to display HP gauges visibly on enemies? And possibly even your allies? Want to give certain enemies different color HP gauges or make it longer than usual?
<WordWrap>Or make it required that enemies must be defeated first before showing their HP gauge? Well, now you can!
<WordWrap>\c[4]Absorption Barriers\c[0] are great to use when party members are already at full \HP.
<WordWrap>Good A.I. can go a long way in making an enemy change from something more simplistic to a more difficult enemy without changing an enemy's stats at all.
<WordWrap>Relaying information in battle to the player matters a whole lot. More information displayed allows the player to make better judgment. Battle visuals help with that.
<WordWrap>Buffs and states aren't as flashy as skills or items to use in battle. However, they can do a whole lot of work in producing special effects that skills normally can't otherwise.
<WordWrap>A solid damage formula concept goes a long way. I highly recommend you figure out the way you want to handle damage early on in your game's development.

<WordWrap>If you want to make your game's elements more engaging, have them operate differently based on themes. For example, \Fire focuses more on area of effect damage while \Volt focuses more on random targeting.
<WordWrap>Targeting rules and selection aren't often thought of, but they can make a big difference in a skill's functionality.
<WordWrap>There are various plugins out there that modify and add more aspects to battle. Give them a try!
\>What \c[4]Misc Battle Plugins\c[0] would you like to learn about?\<
<WordWrap>By default, \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0] limits enemies to only drop up to 3 items max and at very limited drop rates.
<WordWrap>This plugin allows you to add more than 3 items at drop. In addition to having more than 3 drops.
<WordWrap>This plugin also allows you to expand the enemy drops to have conditional drops, drops that will only appear before the player if certain conditions are met.
<WordWrap>This plugin enables you to force a battle advantage on the next upcoming battle, whether it is forced or a random encounter.
<WordWrap>These advantages can be either pre-emptive strikes, surprise attacks, or even forcing a completely normal battle with no advantage.
<WordWrap>This plugin also enables specific common events to play upon different battle types.

<WordWrap>By default, \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0]’s action accuracy formula is unintuitive. For what it matters, the accuracy of the skill is determined first, then the evasion of the target is determined second regardless of the accuracy of the first check.
<WordWrap>This means that even if an attacker has 1000% \c[4]HIT\c[0] accuracy, the skill can still be evaded by the enemy’s 5% \c[4]EVA\c[0] stat.
<WordWrap>So instead, this plugin will provide control over an action’s accuracy formula and evasion formula.

<WordWrap>By this plugin’s default settings, accuracy will now be calculated where the attacker’s \c[4]HIT\c[0] and the enemy’s \c[4]EVA\c[0] are set against one another for a more intuitive accuracy formula.
<WordWrap>\c[4]Life Steal\c[0] is a mechanic in \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0] that only exists in the form of specific skills or items.
<WordWrap>There is no way to passively gain \c[4]Life Steal\c[0] from physical, magical, or certain hit attacks.
<WordWrap>This plugin will allow you to set passive \c[4]Life Steal\c[0] traits for physical, magical, and certain hit attacks for both \HP and \MP values.
<WordWrap>\c[4]Overkill\c[0] occurs when an actor defeats an enemy with excessive damage.

<WordWrap>All enemies have an Overkill damage requirement and if a battler lands a killing blow dealing damage equal to or greater than this number, an animation is played on the enemy before the enemy collapses. When an enemy is overkilled, that enemy will reward the player with more EXP, more gold, a higher drop rate, and if YEP_ExtraEnemyDrops is installed, more possibilities for extra items under the condition of being Overkilled.

<WordWrap>Different types of armors make different sounds when they're hit. When an actor is struck by an attack and takes damage, they will play a sound effect based off the armor they are wearing (ie. cloth versus metal). Enemies can also play different sound effects when they get hit, too (ie. slimes versus robots). Use this plugin to make your armors and enemies more lively when they react to damage.

<WordWrap>For Turn-Based Battle Systems like DTB (Default Turn Battle), letting the player see the turn order visually can add a whole lot more depth to the battle system. This plugin will add a display of icons showing the turn order of the player's party and the enemy party within a corner of the screen (modifiable).

<WordWrap>This plugin lets you assign certain BGM's to certain troops so that they will play from the map transition into the battle. Furthermore, when a major enemy's HP is reduced to certain values, the battle BGM can change as well. This will help add extra feeling to the battle and make battle BGM's less monotonous for longer battles.
<WordWrap>By default, \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0] limits enemies to only drop up to 3 items max and at very limited drop rates.
<WordWrap>This plugin allows you to add more than 3 items at drop. In addition to having more than 3 drops.
<WordWrap>This plugin also allows you to expand the enemy drops to have conditional drops, drops that will only appear before the player if certain conditions are met.
\>What \c[4]Misc Battle Plugins\c[0] would you like to learn about?\<
<WordWrap>By default, \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0] limits enemies to only drop up to 3 items max and at very limited drop rates.
<WordWrap>This plugin allows you to add more than 3 items at drop. In addition to having more than 3 drops.
<WordWrap>This plugin also allows you to expand the enemy drops to have conditional drops, drops that will only appear before the player if certain conditions are met.
<WordWrap>This plugin enables you to force a battle advantage on the next upcoming battle, whether it is forced or a random encounter.
<WordWrap>These advantages can be either pre-emptive strikes, surprise attacks, or even forcing a completely normal battle with no advantage.
<WordWrap>This plugin also enables specific common events to play upon different battle types.

<WordWrap>By default, \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0]’s action accuracy formula is unintuitive. For what it matters, the accuracy of the skill is determined first, then the evasion of the target is determined second regardless of the accuracy of the first check.
<WordWrap>This means that even if an attacker has 1000% \c[4]HIT\c[0] accuracy, the skill can still be evaded by the enemy’s 5% \c[4]EVA\c[0] stat.
<WordWrap>So instead, this plugin will provide control over an action’s accuracy formula and evasion formula.

<WordWrap>By this plugin’s default settings, accuracy will now be calculated where the attacker’s \c[4]HIT\c[0] and the enemy’s \c[4]EVA\c[0] are set against one another for a more intuitive accuracy formula.
<WordWrap>\c[4]Life Steal\c[0] is a mechanic in \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0] that only exists in the form of specific skills or items.
<WordWrap>There is no way to passively gain \c[4]Life Steal\c[0] from physical, magical, or certain hit attacks.
<WordWrap>This plugin will allow you to set passive \c[4]Life Steal\c[0] traits for physical, magical, and certain hit attacks for both \HP and \MP values.
<WordWrap>The \c[4]Absorption Barrier\c[0] is a new mechanic added for battle. \c[4]Barrier Points\c[0], a new type of stat, provide a layer of protection for battlers.
<WordWrap>Any direct damage that would normally be done to \HP would be dealt to the battler's \c[4]Barrier Points\c[0] first, mitigating any real damage dealt to the battler.
<WordWrap>Any remaining damage is then dealt to the battler.
\>What \c[4]Battle Engine Plugins\c[0] would you like to learn about?\<

<WordWrap>The default battle system for \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0] now allows for the ever so popular side-view! However, we can beef it up a little bit more using the Battle Engine Core to add more features and capabilities to the battle system!

<WordWrap>\c[4]Action Sequence Packs\c[0] provide more \c[4]Action Sequences\c[0] to be used with the \c[4]Battle Engine Core\c[0]. The first adds more mechanic-related sequences. The second adds more visual sequences. The third adds zoom functionality.
<WordWrap>This extension plugin allows you to animate enemies in a number of ways to help make your enemies appear more lively!

<WordWrap>The \c[4]ATB\c[0] system starts off with your characters filling up their gauges before they can input an action. Once an action is inputted, they start to quickly charge it up before going to perform their attack.

<WordWrap>Battle participants are placed in a visible turn order based on their agility and speed. When it becomes their turn, they input an action and execute it immediately, then proceed back in line.

<WordWrap>The Standard Turn Battle system functions off of the Default Turn Battle system's structure. Action orders are determined by the battlers' AGI values and they go from highest to lowest. However, actions are not selected at the start of the turn. Instead, the turn progresses and the actions are picked as each battler's turn appears, then proceeds to be executed immediately.

<WordWrap>Each battler is only allowed one action per battle turn, meaning a single battler cannot have twice the number of turns as another battler even if the battler's AGI value is double that of the other. This is to prevent any balancing issues that come from tick-based battle systems as they tend to be far more difficult to balance compared to turn-based battle systems.

<WordWrap>Because of the nature of the Standard Turn Battle System, an item or skill's action speed value found in the database will be disabled as it cannot push forward a battler's in the turn order.

<WordWrap>The default counterattack trait in RPG Maker MV doesn’t give many options for the developer. It’s a skill that flatout cancels out the physical skill of the attacker by evading it and then producing a normal attack from the counterattacker.
<WordWrap>This plugin will give you more control over how counters work in the sense that you can choose to have the counter connect first before allowing the counter skill to proc.
<WordWrap>Want to display HP gauges visibly on enemies? And possibly even your allies? Want to give certain enemies different color HP gauges or make it longer than usual?
<WordWrap>Or make it required that enemies must be defeated first before showing their HP gauge? Well, now you can!

<WordWrap>\c[4]Action Sequence Packs\c[0] provide more \c[4]Action Sequences\c[0] to be used with the \c[4]Battle Engine Core\c[0]. The first adds more mechanic-related sequences. The second adds more visual sequences. The third adds zoom functionality.
<WordWrap>This extension plugin allows you to animate enemies in a number of ways to help make your enemies appear more lively!

<WordWrap>The \c[4]ATB\c[0] system starts off with your characters filling up their gauges before they can input an action. Once an action is inputted, they start to quickly charge it up before going to perform their attack.

<WordWrap>Battle participants are placed in a visible turn order based on their agility and speed. When it becomes their turn, they input an action and execute it immediately, then proceed back in line.

<WordWrap>This plugin will give you more control over how counters work in the sense that you can choose to have the counter connect first before allowing the counter skill to proc.

<WordWrap>Or make it required that enemies must be defeated first before showing their HP gauge? Well, now you can!
<WordWrap>The \c[4]Absorption Barrier\c[0] is a new mechanic added for battle. \c[4]Barrier Points\c[0], a new type of stat, provide a layer of protection for battlers.
<WordWrap>Any direct damage that would normally be done to \HP would be dealt to the battler's \c[4]Barrier Points\c[0] first, mitigating any real damage dealt to the battler.
<WordWrap>Any remaining damage is then dealt to the battler.
\>What \c[4]Buffs & States Plugins\c[0] would you like to learn about?\<
<WordWrap>This plugin alters the basic mechanics behind buffs and states that aren't adjustable within the \c[4]RPG Maker\c[0] editor.
<WordWrap>Such mechanics include altering the maximum number of times buffs can stack, changing the turns remaining on buffs and states, and the rules involved when reapplying states.
<WordWrap>This extension plugin allows you to set categories for your states. They can be one category, multiple categories, or no categories.
<WordWrap>With this in mind, there's a few new features this plugin provides that pertains to this category system.

<WordWrap>Examples include removal of states under a certain category and the ability to have them bypass certain key removal aspects such as on \c[4]Death Removal\c[0] or \c[4]Recover All\c[0] removal.
<WordWrap>Passive Aura Effects are commonly found in many online multiplayer games with RPG elements.
<WordWrap>When a battler can give out an aura, it will affect other nearby battlers, too, either ally and/or foe.
<WordWrap>This plugin will allow statesto generate aura effects for other party members, opponents, or specifically for actor and/or enemy parties.

<WordWrap>For those running a \c[4]Tick-Based Battle System\c[0] with the \c[4]Battle Engine Core\c[0] (ie. \c[4]Active Turn Battle\c[0] or \c[4]Charge Turn Battle\c[0]), this will automatically set your states for Turn End timings to use a Time Based system.
<WordWrap>But in turn, this causes regeneration effects to occur individually.
<WordWrap>States are amongst one of the most important aspects of the battle system. Therefore, relaying proper information to the player is extremely important.
<WordWrap>\c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0] does relay information to the player about the various states and effects, but it is far from perfect.
<WordWrap>This plugin allows you to add more detail and visual effects regarding states to relay proper data.
<WordWrap>Such is done in the way of icons, overlays, and state animations above both actor and enemy parties.
<WordWrap>Previously, actors only had overlays and enemies only had icons. Now, they can have both.
<WordWrap>State animations have also been added to provide indicators that fit other niches of relaying information.
<WordWrap>Actors will also have the ability to use different battle motions when affected by states, too.

<WordWrap>RPG Maker MV does not provide the ability to utilize custom formulas for any damage or healing over time state effects. This plugin, through aid of Yanfly's Buffs & States Core, will allow usage for formulas to create custom damage or healing over time values, animations to go with them, variance control, and elemental rate aspects.
\>What \c[4]Buffs & States Plugins\c[0] would you like to learn about?\<
<WordWrap>This plugin alters the basic mechanics behind buffs and states that aren't adjustable within the \c[4]RPG Maker\c[0] editor.
<WordWrap>Such mechanics include altering the maximum number of times buffs can stack, changing the turns remaining on buffs and states, and the rules involved when reapplying states.
<WordWrap>This extension plugin allows you to set categories for your states. They can be one category, multiple categories, or no categories.
<WordWrap>With this in mind, there's a few new features this plugin provides that pertains to this category system.

<WordWrap>Examples include removal of states under a certain category and the ability to have them bypass certain key removal aspects such as on \c[4]Death Removal\c[0] or \c[4]Recover All\c[0] removal.

<WordWrap>For those running a \c[4]Tick-Based Battle System\c[0] with the \c[4]Battle Engine Core\c[0] (ie. \c[4]Active Turn Battle\c[0] or \c[4]Charge Turn Battle\c[0]), this will automatically set your states for Turn End timings to use a Time Based system.
<WordWrap>But in turn, this causes regeneration effects to occur individually.
\>What \c[4]Damage Plugins\c[0] would you like to learn about?\<

<WordWrap>The \c[4]Damage Core\c[0] plugin enables you to have full control over the damage calculation process of your game ranging from individual damage formulas to damage caps to damage calculation steps.
<WordWrap>This extension plugin scales defensive stats relative to a universal scale and gives your players a way to increase and decrease damage without having to provide pure stats.
<WordWrap>This also adds new gameplay mechanics such as \c[4]Armor Penetration\c[0] and \c[4]Armor Reduction\c[0] into your game!
<WordWrap>This extension plugin allows you to modify the critical hit rate formula across a global scale and for an individual skill/item scale.
\>What \c[4]Damage Plugins\c[0] would you like to learn about?\<

<WordWrap>The \c[4]Damage Core\c[0] plugin enables you to have full control over the damage calculation process of your game ranging from individual damage formulas to damage caps to damage calculation steps.
<WordWrap>This extension plugin scales defensive stats relative to a universal scale and gives your players a way to increase and decrease damage without having to provide pure stats.
<WordWrap>This also adds new gameplay mechanics such as \c[4]Armor Penetration\c[0] and \c[4]Armor Reduction\c[0] into your game!
<WordWrap>This extension plugin allows you to modify the critical hit rate formula across a global scale and for an individual skill/item scale.

<WordWrap>Elemental control in \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0] is pretty lacking. The calculation of how multiple elements are handled aren't very clear nor are they too intuitive when it comes to certain aspects.
<WordWrap>The \c[4]Element Core\c[0] plugin also gives way to skills and items having more than one element, battlers being able to absorb, reflect, amplify elemental damage, and more!

<WordWrap>Elemental control in \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0] is pretty lacking. The calculation of how multiple elements are handled aren't very clear nor are they too intuitive when it comes to certain aspects.
<WordWrap>The \c[4]Element Core\c[0] plugin also gives way to skills and items having more than one element, battlers being able to absorb, reflect, amplify elemental damage, and more!
\>What \c[4]Target Plugins\c[0] would you like to learn about?\<
<WordWrap>The \c[4]Target Core\c[0] plugin is made to expand upon the existing target scopes provided by \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0].

<WordWrap>This plugin enables you to use more target scopes, with a larger variety of ways to target actors and enemies with bonus ways to choose targets combined with the \c[4]Row Formation\c[0] plugin.
<WordWrap>Sometimes, targeting one foe isn’t enough and targeting all foes is too many.
<WordWrap>The right mix in between would be area of effects to target only a certain area of foes.
<WordWrap>This \c[4]Area of Effect\c[0] extension plugin enables area of effect targeting to come in the forms of circular areas, column areas, row areas, and even the whole screen.
<WordWrap>When selecting targets, \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0] has it set by default that the list of valid targets is always either alive enemies, alive allies, or only dead allies.
<WordWrap>Actions would not be able to target either actors or enemies or change from single target to multiple targets.
<WordWrap>This extension plugin for the \c[4]Target Core\c[0] will allow you to break free of that restriction for better selection control of targets as well as insert customized conditions.

<WordWrap>Taunts have become a mainstream game mechanic for many games. It’s only natural to port something like that over to \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0]! Included in this plugin are taunt effects and taunt nullification effects!
\>What \c[4]Target Plugins\c[0] would you like to learn about?\<
<WordWrap>The \c[4]Target Core\c[0] plugin is made to expand upon the existing target scopes provided by \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0].

<WordWrap>This plugin enables you to use more target scopes, with a larger variety of ways to target actors and enemies with bonus ways to choose targets combined with the \c[4]Row Formation\c[0] plugin.

<WordWrap>The right mix in between would be area of effects to target only a certain area of foes.

<WordWrap>This extension plugin for the \c[4]Target Core\c[0] will allow you to break free of that restriction for better selection control of targets as well as insert customized conditions.

<WordWrap>Taunts have become a mainstream game mechanic for many games. It’s only natural to port something like that over to \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0]! Included in this plugin are taunt effects and taunt nullification effects!
\>What \c[4]Battle Visual Plugins\c[0] would you like to learn about?\<

<Wordwrap>This plugin allows you to set custom cursors when selecting allies and/or enemies for targeting while in battle. This is to help with better visual cues when picking a target if the flashing battler isn't enough.
<Wordwrap>This plugin replaces the default battle status window, which was shown in a row format, to a column-based format that also displays the party's faces.
<Wordwrap>This plugin remakes how RPG Maker MV handles battlebacks. By default, all battlebacks are handled in a hard-structured fashion making them hard to modify and alter to behave dynamically.

<Wordwrap>This plugin reworks the way RPG Maker MV's battlebacks behave using a more automatic and flexible means of handling them, allowing battlebacks to added, removed, change its image, fade in/out, adjust opacity settings,
<Wordwrap>Non-animated enemies often appear lifeless. They maintain one appearance throughout the whole battle and do not change it under any circumstances.
<Wordwrap>This plugin allows you to set different images for enemies when they are under certain health percentages as well as other conditions.
<Wordwrap>Replace the default \c[4]RPG Maker\c[0] victory messages with this plugin’s \c[4]Victory Aftermath\c[0] windows to provide more accurate and visual data to your players!

<Wordwrap>The \c[4]Aftermath Level Up\c[0] extension plugin adds a level up section to the Victory Aftermath sequence to show the individual parameter changes the actor has acquired in addition to skills that the actor may have learned.

<Wordwrap>This segment will be omitted if there are no actors to level up or if the game has the segment disabled. When there are multiple actors leveling up, the \c[4]Victory Aftermath\c[0] will cycle through each of the actors.
\>What \c[4]Battle Visual Plugins\c[0] would you like to learn about?\<

<Wordwrap>This plugin allows you to set custom cursors when selecting allies and/or enemies for targeting while in battle. This is to help with better visual cues when picking a target if the flashing battler isn't enough.
<Wordwrap>This plugin replaces the default battle status window, which was shown in a row format, to a column-based format that also displays the party's faces.
<Wordwrap>Replace the default \c[4]RPG Maker\c[0] victory messages with this plugin’s \c[4]Victory Aftermath\c[0] windows to provide more accurate and visual data to your players!

<Wordwrap>The \c[4]Aftermath Level Up\c[0] extension plugin adds a level up section to the Victory Aftermath sequence to show the individual parameter changes the actor has acquired in addition to skills that the actor may have learned.

<Wordwrap>This segment will be omitted if there are no actors to level up or if the game has the segment disabled. When there are multiple actors leveling up, the \c[4]Victory Aftermath\c[0] will cycle through each of the actors.
<WordWrap>Tired of dumb enemies that turn your otherwise challenging game into an easy-peasy walk in the park?
<WordWrap>The \c[4]Battle A.I. Core\c[0] plugin allows you to manually adjust the settings and patterns of your enemies so that they can deliver MANLY poundings onto your players.
<WordWrap>Tired of dumb enemies that turn your otherwise challenging game into an easy-peasy walk in the park?
<WordWrap>The \c[4]Battle A.I. Core\c[0] plugin allows you to manually adjust the settings and patterns of your enemies so that they can deliver MANLY poundings onto your players.
The further you go in life, the more you realize
that no one has a clue what they're doing.
Sometimes, we need to lose the small battles
in order to win the big war.
A dark knight is simply a white knight who has seen
<WordWrap>The \c[4]Battle Arena\c[0] is still under construction, but would you like to fight some worthy opponents in the meantime?
<WordWrap>Congratulations on winning! The \c[4]Championship Belt\c[0] is now yours!
Knowledge of the battlefield is different from

<WordWrap>Hello, I'm making a game as well, and I have to give a big thanks to \c[6]Yanfly\c[0], \c[6]FlyingDream\c[0], \c[6]Echo607\c[0] and many others. Now I have to get off my lazy butt and get a demo out...
The strongest people are not those who show strength
in front of us, but those who win battles we know
The best ways, don't always lead
The alarm clock can never win. You'll get mad at
it when it wakes you up and you'll get mad at it
The more you weight, the harder you are to kidnap.
Singing in the shower is all fun and games until
you get shampoo in your mouth. Then it just becomes
The people who become the most successful are those who
realize an internal battle is going on, and do whatever
it takes to win that battle.
You may have to fight a battle more than once
I stopped fighting my inner demons.
The ability to create is not given
It's not the destination we should seek,
but instead the journey that takes us there.
The thrill of battle must not be taken lightly
for it also means you take your life lightly.
Fight your fears and you'll be in a battle forever.
Face your fears and you'll be free forever.
In preparing for battle, I have always found that
plans are useless, but planning is indispensable.
"I followed my heart and it led me
Well met. I am called Dragon. Where I am from, I am
considered to be the strongest above all others. But even
back home, there are forces that even I must respect.
I have come here for several reasons, and one of them
is to see where I stand in terms of power.
For better or worse, I have not met my match here yet,
but should I find someone stronger, I could only benefit
Life, of course, is about more than fighting, especially
when that life is eternal. I also like to play guitar, and
have been practicing together with Lars VanVoder.
I believe Lars is staying at the inn along with his
sister Lydia. The eldest, Lyle, is also in town,
though he doesn't get along well with his siblings.
In time, I hope they are able to reconcile. To that end,
I have been mentoring both Lydia and Lyle, both in combat
as well as in several other aspects of life.
If you ever visit my home, be sure to come to one
of my shows. I promise I'm a lot more exciting when
I'm up on stage than when I'm standing around here.
